title: Typical big plays in LCS
body:
Swain cleans up a team fight with pentakill

" He has full sustain with ult; OK play with the root into ult, good work to Swain for taking advantage of that, well deserved"

meanwhile

*Thresh Lands a hook*

HOLY FUCK!!! BIG PLAY THERE, YOU SEE THAT!!!?? NOW LEE SIN COMES IN FOR DOUBLE KILL, OH GOD DOUBLE Q'S UNDER TURRET, TURRET HOP OUT!!! CAN HE GET TRIPLE??!?!? HE DOES!!! Q AGAIN INTO ULT KICK."

*Shaco comes in behind ADC and Supp*

"Oh double kill for Shaco. Bottom really should lay down some pink wards, this happens quite a bit since Shaco can go invisible folks. Nothing else to see though"

*Zed Ults Ahri under turret"

"AMAZING PLAY!!! QSS THE CHARM INTO ULT AND Q, ZED CANCELS ULT AND GETS OUTSIDE OF TURRET RANGE, WOW THE TIMING AND THE PLAY ON THAT. SUCH A TURN OF EVENTS THEIR TURRET DIVE USING ULT, INCREDIBLE PLAY BY ZED!!"

having played cass extremely little but ori pretty often, how is the former's ult harder to land than the latter's?
To get the stun on Cass's ult the enemy must be facing you, if they aren't it is just a slow.  So they are both hard, but Cass's arguably requires better timing.

Orianna's ult is a larger circular radius, where Cass's is just a cone, Cass is targeted from her position which means she has to be in close range of her targets, whereas Orianna can throw the ball out and have it out there distancing herself from *some* danger. Cass's ult is a stun if being faced and a slow if their back is towards her, meaning a 4 man stun is basically her jumping into death wish range and getting lucky that 4 men are staring her down without sluaghtering her before she lands her ult.
thank you, I'm not sure how I feel about her ult functioning like that (with the whole stun if facing you thing).

Your point makes sense, but you have to consider something:

The popular plays in other sports arent based on the player, it is based on what they accomplished. If a guy that plays Lineman was forced to do quarterback and did the game winning throw, the sportcaster would go nuts.

In LoL, however, it is about who did it. Cassiopeia stunning an entire team is, for all intents and purposes, the same thing as Orianna's 5 man ult. Just like Shaco getting a Double bot is the same as Lee Sin. The sole difference in these scenarios was WHO did it.

And thats the issue. While other sports have a bias torwards certain roles, LoL has bias torwards the characters themselves.

To make it worse, Riot wont allow the "boring" champions to be stronger than what they like. This hurts the balance for everyone.
Because commentators for other sports/e-sports are *completely* accurate and unbiased.

It is probably due to some champions being spammed while others are rare picks. When a Swain is picked he already causes excitement since you don't know what to expect. The announcers don't have to yell because their rarity of play makes them exciting. Champions like Zed, Lee, or Thresh on the other hand are spammed so much that without the announcers constantly screaming, the audience would lose interest quickly.

That, and the simpler the champion, the less they have to make sure everyone is tracking with what the pro is doing with them. Zed Deathmarking in, using certain abilities, juking a snare, activating BotRK and Ignite, and the shadowing out is a lot more visually confusing than a Caitlyn lining up an Ace in the hole shot. Normally, they only note about the Cait snipe if it deals an unbelievable amount of damage or the enemy team saves somebody from getting executed.

Enjoying the Riot favors champions circlejerk? I'm pretty sure the LCS announcers would get excited about grass growing on summoners rift let alone when any champion uses literally any ability in the direction of another champion.

Also, your Shacco example makes no sense because without having watched more than a few games this year I'm pretty sure he hasn't been picked.
I would scream if they made the grass on the rift actually grow, it could be so lifelike!
